notes: Third-generation LS flagship sedan. Refined V8 powertrain. Advanced luxury features for era. Exceptional build quality and reliability. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus LS article, January 2025 revision.

Fourth-generation LS. First production 8-speed automatic transmission. LS 600h L hybrid variant with V8 hybrid. AWD available. Hybrid requires specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus LS article, January 2025 revision.
Fourth-generation ES mid-size sedan. Based on Toyota Camry platform. Reliable and comfortable. Popular entry-luxury sedan. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus ES article, January 2025 revision.
Fifth-generation ES. V6-only powertrain. Based on Camry platform. Smooth and comfortable ride. Popular luxury sedan. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus ES article, January 2025 revision.

First-generation IS sport sedan. Inline-six engine (2JZ). Manual transmission available. Rear-wheel drive. SportCross wagon variant. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus IS article, January 2025 revision.

Second-generation IS sport sedan. Available as IS 250 or IS 350. Manual transmission on some models. Convertible variant (IS 250C/350C). AWD available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus IS article, January 2025 revision.
Second-generation GS sport sedan. Available with inline-six or V8. Rear-wheel drive. Sporty handling. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus GS article, January 2025 revision.

Hybrid variant of GS. 3.5L V6 with hybrid system. 340 hp combined. Performance-oriented luxury sedan. Hybrid system requires specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus GS article, January 2025 revision.
Second-generation RX luxury crossover. RX 330 became RX 350 in 2007. Best-selling Lexus model. Available FWD or AWD. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus RX article, January 2025 revision.

First luxury hybrid SUV. 3.3L V6 hybrid system. AWD standard. Pioneered hybrid luxury crossovers. Hybrid system requires specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus RX article, January 2025 revision.

First-generation GX body-on-frame luxury SUV. Based on Toyota Land Cruiser Prado. V8 powertrain. Off-road capability. Three-row seating. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus GX article, January 2025 revision.

Second-generation LX flagship SUV. Based on Toyota Land Cruiser J100. V8 powertrain. Extreme off-road capability. Three-row seating for 8. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus LX article, January 2025 revision.

Third-generation LX. Based on Toyota Land Cruiser J200. 5.7L V8 powertrain. Advanced off-road systems. Three-row seating. Flagship luxury SUV. Data sourced from Wikipedia Lexus LX article, January 2025 revision.
